FuncDef: The display snmp-agent notification-log command displays alarm logs in an alarm buffer. The display snmp-agent notification-log command displays alarm logs in an alarm buffer.
CLIs: display snmp-agent notification-log [ logtime <startTime> <startDate> to <endTime> <endDate> | size <size> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the start time when a device logs alarms.
The value is in the HH:MM:SS format, where HH:MM:SS indicates the hour, minute, and second. HH ranges from 0 to 23; MM and SS range from 0 to 59.

Specifies the start date when a device logs alarms.
The value is in the format of YYYY/MM/DD. The YYYY value ranges from 2000 to 2099, the MM value ranges from 1 to 12, and the DD value ranges from 1 to 31.

Specifies the end time when a device stops logging alarms.
The value is in the HH:MM:SS format, where HH:MM:SS indicates the hour, minute, and second. HH ranges from 0 to 23; MM and SS range from 0 to 59.

Specifies the end date when a device stops logging alarms.
The value is in the YYYY/MM/DD format. YYYY/MM/DD indicates year/month/day. YYYY ranges from 2000 to 2099, MM ranges from 1 to 12, and DD ranges from 1 to 31.

Specifies the recent alarm logs to be displayed.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 15000. If the specified number of alarm logs to be displayed exceeds the number of alarm logs currently saved by the system, information on all alarm logs in the alarm buffer is displayed.

Indicates information in an alarm buffer. The information includes the number of global alarm logs in the alarm buffer, the number of discarded alarm logs, aging time of alarm logs, limitation on the number of alarm logs, total number of existing alarm logs, and enabling status of alarm logging.
-

ExtraInfo: You can set the following conditions for displaying detailed information about alarm logs in the alarm buffer:
